listitem.para: To complement other such platforms or libraries (GATE, OpenNLP, etc.), not to replace them
To make it easier to build applications for Indian (actually, South Asian) languages by addressing problems specific to them and taking advantage of their special characteristics
To provide a place where independent components can live together without making each others' lives difficult
To make available things to researchers and users which were not available till now
To make research and development easier for myself
It is easier and faster to write open source code in Java
There are more freely usable libraries (including for NLP) in Java than elsewhere
Java may not be the ideal programming language, but it seems to be the best option right now
Java allows better engineering than most other languages
I am comfortable with Java
There are Eclipse and Netbeans for Java
Due to all the other advantages of Java and Object Oriented Technology
For editing in Indian languages

For

sect1.title: Can I use or modify the APIs?
sect1.para: At your own risk. As mentioned in the disclaimers section, the design of Sanchay has not yet stabilised, so it would be better if you wait for some time before making your applications very dependent on Sanchay APIs. You can, of course, use the separately executable applications like the annotation interfaces.
If you want to modify the APIs for Sanchay itself, read about contributing below.

sect1.title: Where can I get the latest version?
sect1.para: You can get the latest version at Sourceforge.net. You may also want to check out the Sanchay home page.

sect1.title: How to find what I need?

listitem.para: Read the Sanchay User Guide
Look at the Sanchay home page
See the Java API documentation for Sanchay (it's not very well done at present, it might help)
If you have done all the above and were not able to find, ask me.

sect1.title: Can I contribute?
sect1.para: Sure. Just get familiar with the Sanchay architecture etc. and if what you build is compatible with Sanchay, it can become a part of Sanchay. Your contribution will be acknowledged (assuming it's something more than writing a five line program). Of course, you won't be paid anything because I don't have anything to pay you with. The financial turnover of Sanchay is Rs. 0.0 (this is an inflated figure).

sect1.title: I have already done something in Java. Can it be added to Sanchay?
sect1.para: The answer is almost the same as above.

sect1.title: What is the business model?
sect1.para: xi builds ym and xj uses yn at monetary price p

listitem.para: where i, j, m and n are random integers from the set {1, 2, 3, ..., N}
N = population of the world at any instant t during building or using
and p = 0

sect1.title: Is the business model likely to change?
sect1.para: Not if I can help it.

sect1.title: Who Owns Sanchay?
sect1.para: I don't think anyone does. But since this there is no one else right now to break her or his head on this platform, I am there.
